questions.question_text_1: If we choose the Euclidean distance measure, what will the optimal solution be?
question_texts: If we choose the Euclidean distance measure, what will the optimal solution be?

options.option_text: Euclidean distance measure will result in a single point optimal solution
Metropolitan metric distance will result in a range for the optimal solution
Both Euclidean distance measure will result in a single point optimal solution &Metropolitan metric distance will result in a range for the optimal solution are wrong
Both Euclidean distance measure will result in a single point optimal solution &Metropolitan metric distance will result in a range for the optimal solution are correct

props.summary:
### Summary of Core Topics, Concepts, Principles, and Equations

#### Industry 4.0
- **Definition**: The fourth industrial revolution, characterized by the integration of digital technologies into industrial processes.
- **Progression**: Steam engine -> Assembly line -> IT -> IoT
- **Country of Origin**: United Kingdom
- **Transportation**: Hyperloop

#### Location Problems
- **Factors**: Distance, Number of facilities, Optimization criteria
- **Distance Metrics**:
  - **Euclidean Distance**:
    \[
    d_{ij} = \sqrt{(x_i - x_j)^2 + (y_i - y_j)^2}
    \]
  - **Metropolitan Distance**:
    \[
    d_{ij} = |(x_i - x_j)| + |(y_i - y_j)|
    \]
- **Optimal Solutions**:
  - Euclidean distance results in a single point optimal solution.
  - Metropolitan distance results in a range for the optimal solution.

#### Cross-Median Approach
- **Definition**: A method for determining the optimal location based on demand density.

#### Production Line Efficiency
- **Efficiency Calculation**:
  \[
  \text{Efficiency} = \left( \frac{\text{Total Activity Time}}{\text{Number of Workstations} \times \text{Cycle Time}} \right) \times 100
  \]
- **Cycle Time**: The time it takes to complete one cycle of the production process.
- **Maximum Possible Output**: The theoretical maximum number of units that can be produced in a given time.

#### Supplier Selection Problem
- **Itemsets and Support**:
  - **Itemset**: A set of items (attributes) that appear together in a dataset.
  - **Support**: The frequency of an itemset in the dataset.
  - **Association Rules**: Rules that describe the relationship between itemsets, with a minimum support threshold.

### Knowledge Graph 

```mermaid
graph TD;
    A[Industry 4.0] --> B[Progression]
    A --> C[Country of Origin]
    A --> D[Transportation]
    B --> E[Steam Engine]
    B --> F[Assembly Line]
    B --> G[IT]
    B --> H[IoT]
    C --> I[United Kingdom]
    D --> J[Hyperloop]

    K[Location Problems] --> L[Factors]
    K --> M[Distance Metrics]
    K --> N[Optimal Solutions]
    L --> O[Distance]
    L --> P[Number of Facilities]
    L --> Q[Optimization Criteria]
    M --> R[Euclidean Distance]
    M --> S[Metropolitan Distance]
    N --> T[Single Point Solution]
    N --> U[Range Solution]

    V[Cross-Median Approach] --> W[Demand Density]

    X[Production Line Efficiency] --> Y[Efficiency Calculation]
    X --> Z[Cycle Time]
    X --> AA[Maximum Possible Output]

    AB[Supplier Selection Problem] --> AC[Itemsets and Support]
    AB --> AD[Association Rules]
    AC --> AE[Itemset]
    AC --> AF[Support]
```

### Additional Knowledge Graph for Production Line Efficiency

```mermaid
graph TD;
    A[Production Line Efficiency] --> B[Efficiency Calculation]
    A --> C[Cycle Time]
    A --> D[Maximum Possible Output]
    B --> E[Total Activity Time]
    B --> F[Number of Workstations]
    B --> G[Cycle Time]
```

This summary and the knowledge graphs should help you understand the core topics and their relationships, making it easier to prepare for the exam.
